newsitem.title: CHINA: PRESS DIGEST - Chinese newspapers - Oct 9.
newsitem.headline: PRESS DIGEST - Chinese newspapers - Oct 9.

text.p: Following is a summary of major Chinese political and business stories in leading newspapers, prepared by Reuters in Beijing. Reuters has not checked the stories and does not guarantee their accuracy. Telephone: (8610) 6532-1921. Fax: (8610) 6532-4978.
China plans to boost investment and speed the construction of water management projects to combat natural disasters, as officials prepare law on flood prevention.
Premier Li Peng calls for international cooperation in the space industry.
Bus workers from 11 cities pledge to learn from Li Suli, a model bus conductor in Beijing who has served passengers wholeheartedly for 15 years.
Senior Taiwan affairs official Tang Shubei calls for early political negotiations between Beijing and Taipei to help restore stability and develop ties across the Taiwan Strait.
A report by the State Information Centre says the fourth quarter to offer a golden opportunity to lower interest rates.
Securities authorities fine Shandong Bohai Group 500,000 yuan for falsifying reports on its financial status.
Article calls for central bank to cut reserve ratio for commercial banks to allow them to increase loans to Chinese companies.
Southwest China's Sichuan province expects a new record in grain output this year, with total output to reach 45.8 million tonnes this year.
